CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award;Costs and expenses partial award
TEXT: CARDINAL . On DATE , the applicant was instructed to inform the police who had parked a car belonging to the applicant in the NORP in GPE on DATE at CARDINAL . He failed to provide the information , and on DATE was fined CARDINAL NORP schillings ( ORG ) for the failure , pursuant to sections CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) and CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) of LAW DATE ( ORG ) . The penal notice ( PERSON ) was confirmed by ORG ( ORG PERSON ) on DATE . On DATE a minor error in the penal order was corrected .

CARDINAL . The applicant 's administrative complaint to ORG ( Verwaltungsgerichtshof ) was ultimately dismissed on DATE . ORG found that the correct provisions of LAW had been applied , and further confirmed that the reasons given by the applicant for not having supplied the required information were inadequate .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) of LAW DATE entitles the competent authority , inter alia , to require the registered owner of a motor vehicle to communicate the name and address of a person who has used the vehicle at a specific time .

CARDINAL . Under section CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) it is an administrative offence ( Verwaltungsübertretung ) not to comply with the above - mentioned provision , punishable by a fine of up to ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL or CARDINAL GPE imprisonment in case of default .
CARDINAL . For a description of the relevant domestic procedure , reference is made to the PERSON v. GPE judgment of DATE ( Series A no . CARDINAL-B , pp . DATE , § § DATE ) .
